import React from "react" import "../Components/AboutPage.css" const AboutPage = () => { return (

Shindano Singi

(207) 713-3345 ∙ 78 Maple Street, Apt. 31, Lewiston, ME 04240 ∙Shindanosingi1@gmail.com{" "}

• Computer Science | Electrical Engineer graduated in September 2021. Prepared to sit for FE. • Experience in electromechanical industry work (textiles) machine use and repair • Electrical Engineering skills: Systems Dynamics, Microprocessor Systems, Digital Logic, Robotics, Analog and Digital Signal and Systems Processing, Electronics Devices and Design, Micro Electro Mechanical Systems (MEMS), Analog Circuit Design, Electromagnetic Fields, Engineering Communications, PLC • Math Skills: Linear Algebra, and Calculus Sequence, and Differential Equations, Statistics • Languages / Software: Python, JAVA, Visual Basic Studio, SolidWorks, L-Edit, Matlab • Strong oral and written (technical writing) skills English. Bilingual: French & Swahili. EDUCATION • University of Southern Maine, Portland, ME B.S. (Electrical Engineering), Graduated in May 2020 • Central Maine Community College Associates Degree (Electromechanical Technology), Greduated in June 2015 • Institut de la Fraternité, Tanzania Diploma in Business and Administration, 2007 ● Scholarships include: WEX; College Dean, Eagle Jackson, & Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society, Lewiston Auburn Metropolitan Chamber Scholarship Recipient, President’s Honors List ● Awards: Best 2nd Poster presented at ASEE 2019 conference at the University at Buffalo, Undergraduate Research Opportunity (UROP), Maine Space Grant Consortium (MSGC) PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE SIEMENS INC, Scarborough, ME. March 2020 - Present HVAC SYSTEMS DESIGN and CONTROL ENGINEER ● Participate in turnover meetings ● Do project labor plan in excel ● Do valve schedule ● Do damper schedule ● Design HVAC systems (AHU, Hot Water Systems, Chilled Water Systems...) in Autocad, based on contract drawings, Div23, Div25 and Div26 requirements. ● Draw wiring diagram of devices to controllers in Autocad. ● Create controllers and points in Design Tools (DT) software. U.S. Citizen Shindano Singi (207) 713-3345 ∙ 78 Maple Street, Apt. 31, Lewiston, ME 04240 ∙Shindanosingi1@gmail.com ● Assign point addresses to devices such temperature sensors, valve actuators, damper actuators, VFDs, Boilers, fans... ● Create Commissioning Tools (CT) database ● Export points database from DT to CT. ● Create a submittal for the PM. ● Do Engineering Re-Estimate. Softwares ● Use "Wrike" software for project management and communication ● Use "Teams" for communication (chat, audio and video calls) ● Use "BluBeam" for documents management ● Use "Si-Quote" for sales estimates ● Use "SAP" for time reporting ● Use "DayForce" for time reporting ● Use "ABT" software for DXR controllers management ● Microsoft Outlook ● Microsoft excel ● Microsoft Word ● Microsoft PowerPoint ● Certification ● I have have obtained a lot of certificates at Siemens: 1. HVAC 2. Valves selection 3. Damper selection 4. AHU 5. Siemens Controllers (PXCs and PXMs) 6. Siemens Controllers (DXRs) 7. OSHA ... Awards ● I was awarded hard working and quick learner employee at Siemens ABB, Auburn, ME September 2019 – March 2020 LEAN Engineering Intern (September 2019 – March 2020) ● Use LEAN tools such as GEMBA (Go and see how the job is done) on the production floor to identify what needs to be improved and find the solution ● Provide support to machine operators in both Vertical Machining Center (VMC) and Weld Braze departments ● Make shadow boards for both VMC and Wels Braze U.S. Citizen Shindano Singi (207) 713-3345 ∙ 78 Maple Street, Apt. 31, Lewiston, ME 04240 ∙Shindanosingi1@gmail.com ● Write Standard Operation Procedure (SOP) and organize tools to improve operators’ safety and production flow ● Design and assemble parts in Moonshine shop using various mechanical, electrical, hydraulic... tools such as Milling machine (Bridgeport), heat bender, shop saws, ... ● Use hammer drill to drill holes in the concrete ● Use 3D printer (Ender 3) to make plastic parts ● Did PLC wiring on an automated machine ● Wired a single-phase LEESON motor ● Disconnected and wired 480V and 120V gang boxes, respectively ● Lead solution team meeting for both VMC and Weld Braze departments ● Made chip guards for all VMC machines ● Added more features to an existing table to satisfy work flow needs ● Made a table for box making ● Successfully installed electrical, mechanical, hydraulic and air operated devices ● Facilitate communication between management, employees and maintenance ● Worked on individual Projects: o Anode light Nomenclature o Preventive Maintenance (PM) tracking o Weld Braze layout iteration ● Worked on team projects and presented them to all leaders in the plant: o Printer Integration o Passivation Process o Deburr Relocation University of Southern Maine (USM), Portland, ME August 2018 – May 2020 Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program Project (May 2019 - May 2020) Design and Redesign of Micro Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS) Piezoelectric Vibration Energy and sensing devices using Finite Element Modeling softwares: Solidworks and ANSYS. Electronics Laboratory Technician, Electrical Engineering Department (January 2019 – Sept. 2019) Provided technical support to students performing electronics lab experiments. Maintained equipment. Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program Assistant (Aug 2018 – May 2019) Test the Micro Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS) device: Piezoelectric Vibration Energy Harvester, that I designed in the MEMS class. Catholic Charities of Maine, Interpreter, Portland, ME July 2019 – March 2020 Interpret (oral) and translate (written) English into/from French, Swahili, and Kibembe House of Languages, Interpreter, Portland, ME Aug. 2015 – Present Interpret (oral) and translate (written) English into/from French, Swahili, and Kibembe L.L. Bean Manufacturing, Brunswick, ME July 2013 – Oct. 2018 U.S. Citizen Shindano Singi (207) 713-3345 ∙ 78 Maple Street, Apt. 31, Lewiston, ME 04240 ∙Shindanosingi1@gmail.com Bean’s Boots Machine Operator: monogram textiles and maintain equipment(Oct. 2014 – Oct. 2018) Volunteer Stretch Break Leader: led 50 + employees on health breaks (Oct. 2014 – Oct. 2016) Embroidery Machine Operator: embroider textiles and maintain equipment (July 2013 – Oct. 2014). Central Maine Community College, Electrician Intern, Auburn, ME May 2015 – Jul. 2015 Assisted certified electricians with installing new electrical and electronic devices. Amani Yao Atelier de Couture, Tailor, Tanzania 2007 – 2020 Designed, measured, cut, stitched, and hand-tailored shirts, pants and dresses.

) } export default AboutPage
